docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5-- Secretary of State Dean Rusk informed nineteen Latin-American envoys today of the United States' determination to prevent the export of communism from Cuba.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5-- Secretary of State Dean Rusk informed nineteen Latin-American envoys today of the United States' determination to prevent the export of communism from Cuba.

headline.main: RUSK TELLS LATINS CUBAN COMMUNISM MUST BE BLOCKED; Explains to 19 Envoys U.S. Determination to Prevent Export of Marxism RUSK TELLS LATINS OF POLICY ON CUBA

docs.snippet: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 6 David E. Kaufman, lawyer and former United States Minister to Bolivia and Siam, now Thailand, died last night in the University of Pennsylvania Hospital. He was 79 years old and lived in the Rittenhouse Plaza apartments.
docs.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 6 David E. Kaufman, lawyer and former United States Minister to Bolivia and Siam, now Thailand, died last night in the University of Pennsylvania Hospital. He was 79 years old and lived in the Rittenhouse Plaza apartments.

headline.main: David E. Kaufman Is Dead at 79; Ex-Minister to Bolivia and Siam; Lawyer Served in Diplomatic Corps Since 1928 Was UNESCO Delegate in '54

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8--Calls to "do something about Cuba" echoed through Washington this week, reaching even to the serene courtyard of the Pan American Union Building.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8--Calls to "do something about Cuba" echoed through Washington this week, reaching even to the serene courtyard of the Pan American Union Building.

headline.main: O.A.S.' POWER DIFFICULT TO FOCUS; Hemisphere Group Hesitates to Act Strongly Against One of Own Broad Tasks Nonintervention Some Demand Action

byline.original: By ARTHUR J. OLSEN Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: IN Latin America, as elsewhere, old soldiers never die. But there, only  too often, they decide that the good of their country requires them to take power--or to decide which civilians will rule in their name. During the past twelve months alone,...
docs.lead_paragraph: IN Latin America, as elsewhere, old soldiers never die. But there, only too often, they decide that the good of their country requires them to take power--or to decide which civilians will rule in their name. During the past twelve months alone, military leaders have intervened in Brazil, Argentina, Ecuador and Peru.

headline.main: When Generals Take Over in Latin America; A wave of militarism is sweeping the southern half of the hemisphere, throwing over democratically elected governments. What hope is there for the forces of reform? When Generals Take Over

docs.snippet: PORT OF SPAIN, Trinidad, Sept. 3--The guessing game over Chaguaramas, the United States naval base situated on a peninsula a few miles north of this capital, is daily becoming more intense, enmeshed in local politics.
docs.lead_paragraph: PORT OF SPAIN, Trinidad, Sept. 3--The guessing game over Chaguaramas, the United States naval base situated on a peninsula a few miles north of this capital, is daily becoming more intense, enmeshed in local politics.
docs.abstract: Williams attack on US over base seen maneuver in bargaining over econ aid; US hints it will withdraw from base if William's price is too high; map

headline.main: Trinidad Pressing U.S on Navy Base's Status; Raising of Issue Believed Linked to Aid Maneuver Withdrawal Is Considered If Price Is Too High

byline.original: Special to The New York Times. By PAUL P. KENNEDY

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 20--While the traditional Colorado and Blanco political parties are weakening their strength with internal fights, Uruguay's Leftist parties are seeking to join forces for a strong showing in the Nov. 25 general elections.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 20--While the traditional Colorado and Blanco political parties are weakening their strength with internal fights, Uruguay's Leftist parties are seeking to join forces for a strong showing in the Nov. 25 general elections.
docs.abstract: Leftist parties press unity effort for strong showing in Nov 25 elections; traditional parties weakened by internal fights
